Welcome to 2.854.1x Introduction to Manufacturing Systems Engineering. This is the second module in our new Principles of Manufacturing MicroMasters program, and while our focus here is on the topic of randomness and variation in manufacturing settings, we urge you to look at the complete set of modules in the MicroMasters, which all revolve around the theme of flow (of material and information) and variation at various levels of manufacturing. 

If you're new to edX we highly encourage you to view DemoX to learn about the edX learning experience.

There will be one timed exam in this course - be sure to block out your schedule accordingly. The final exam will be released on May 29 and must be completed prior to June 5. This date, as well as all due dates for the weekly Graded Problem Sets are fixed and cannot be changed or modified for any individuals, please plan accordingly.

What to Expect from 2.854.1x:
This course will follow a weekly program for a total of 7 weeks. Each week, you will receive new lecture videos, finger exercises and a homework assignment (except for week 1) as we build toward the final exam. The best way you can prepare for the course now is to ensure that you have adequate time scheduled in the coming weeks to complete the course.

What You'll Learn:

Probability Basics
Stochastic Processes
Queuing Theory
Inventory Management
Toyota Production System
Single Part Type Manufacturing Lines


Certificate of Achievement:
We hope you want to learn for the sake of learning, but you can get additional value for your career by purchasing a verified certificate. You must be registered as Verified by no later than May 3rd - no exceptions. Here are a few reasons to consider upgrading to a verified certificate. 



Provides solid proof of your achievement
Looks great on your resume when applying for new jobs or that next promotion
Working toward a certificate helps keep you motivated
The nominal fee helps edX and MITx continue to provide low-cost educational opportunities to the world
It is required for the MicroMasters credential.

Welcome to the residential MITx site for 2.853/2.854 Introduction to Manufacturing Systems.

In this course you will learn how to analyze manufacturing systems to optimize performance and control cost. You will develop an understanding of seemingly opaque production lines with a particular emphasis on random disruptive events – their effects and how to deal with them, as well as inventory dynamics and management.

On this site, you will find the Graded Problem Sets for weeks 1 - 7, and also videos, exercises, and readings to enrich your learning of the material.

If you're new to the edX platform you can take a quick course DemoX to get oriented.
